subject: Re: Native Library already loaded in another classloader
msgSnippet: I too have seen this.  It only seems to happen (at least for me) when I use the GUI,  if I run with junit.textui.TestRunner I do not see it.  Seems as if the
messageBody:
I too have seen this. It only seems to happen (at least for me) when
I use the GUI, if I run with junit.textui.TestRunner I do not see
it. Seems as if the GUI loads it once and trys to re-use it over and
over.

Jim


--- In junit@y..., Scott Coleman <scott.coleman@1...> wrote:
>
> I was under the impression that a native class should only be
loaded once and that is why most
> loadLibrary calls are done in a wrapper class that loads the
library in its static initializer so
> that it is only loaded once.
>
> On Fri,
> 26 Jan 2001, you wrote: Hi,
>
> The code I'm testing calls System.loadLibrary( "JNIExperiment" )
> once. One test run gets green. But every second(!) time I hit the
> TestRunner Run button I get the following exception:
>
> java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library JNIExperiment.dll
> already loaded in another classloader.
>
> What to do?
>
> Regards
>
> Marc
>
>
>
